channel.title: 732 Packet Error
channel.description:
Decided to start trying to learn higher revision coding, but i'm still fairly new..
I'm sure i'm just being an idiot when i ask this but i really don't have the experience to figure it out i suppose, so if someone could kindly explain this so i can try to learn it i would be greatly appreciative.
Basically what's going on is, There was an anti-leech on the source i decided to use in the NPCHandler which i had fixed, now when i kill an NPC I get this and my client crashes right after, which i think is another part of the anti-leech, but i've never done much with packets so i'm extremely lost... anyway, the error in the RUN.CMD Looks like this:
[CODE] [WorldPacketsDecoder] Missing packet 16, expected size: 2, actual size: 2 [/CODE]
I'm not sure if i'm looking at the right bit, but my guess was it was something to do with this in the WorldPacketsDecoder [CODE] PACKET_SIZES[16] = 2; [/CODE]
Like i said i'm very unsure what this is because i'm new to these high revisions. But if someone could explain what is causing this/What is needed to fix it i would greatly appreciate it!
~Thanks in Advance!

item.title: 732 Packet Error
item.dc:creator: @Bludstained Bludstained
item.description:
@Bludstained wrote:

Decided to start trying to learn higher revision coding, but i’m still fairly new…

I’m sure i’m just being an idiot when i ask this but i really don’t have the experience to figure it out i suppose, so if someone could kindly explain this so i can try to learn it i would be greatly appreciative.

Basically what’s going on is, There was an anti-leech on the source i decided to use in the NPCHandler which i had fixed, now when i kill an NPC I get this and my client crashes right after, which i think is another part of the anti-leech, but i’ve never done much with packets so i’m extremely lost… anyway, the error in the RUN.CMD Looks like this:

[WorldPacketsDecoder] Missing packet 16, expected size: 2, actual size: 2

I’m not sure if i’m looking at the right bit, but my guess was it was something to do with this in the WorldPacketsDecoder

PACKET_SIZES[16] = 2;

Like i said i’m very unsure what this is because i’m new to these high revisions. But if someone could explain what is causing this/What is needed to fix it i would greatly appreciate it!

~Thanks in Advance!
